# \color{colorwhite} Developing Andic corpus

## Andic Language

Andi (Andic < Avar-Andic < East Caucasian, glottocode [andi1255]) is spoken in several villages of the Botlikh district of Dagestan. In addition, some speakers of Andi have resettled to the lowlands and cities in other districts of Dagestan. I will call the idiom spoken in the village of Andi Andi proper and reserve the term Andi for the whole range of Andi dialects. Overall, the total number of Andi speakers is estimated by [@aglarov02: 3] as more than 20,000. The All-Russian National Census conducted in 2010 provides similar numbers.
